channel.title: My First Model Ever :D [not a recolor]
channel.description:
oHiThere ;D this is the first model i've ever made (tnx to the good tutorial of SilentCJ)
Some Pics: [IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/27yr6mg.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/21eh38.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i38.tinypic.com/69pbn6.png[/img]
Look at the pics and tell what you think about it.... (don't forget its my first model ever)
P.S. i have the model + ints for those who want it.. if you want it, PM me.

item.title: My First Model Ever :D [not a recolor]
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

krackkid:

Well I think it sucks sorry but even for a first it sucks. if you read CJ’s tut you could make somthing better then that.

If your going to criticize someones model, then tell them how they can improve it.

Tbh, i think it’s good for a first attempt, i love the blade but try making the handle rounded instead (Use a prim)

3/5

Read full topic
item.source: My First Model Ever :D [not a recolor]

item.title: My First Model Ever :D [not a recolor]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

14-08:

[quote]i think its good (better than my first tbh) and krakkid the most you have ever made was 2 sticks >.>

Krackkid’s ‘two sticks’ looked a lot better than this. Mainly because it was actually smooth and there were not random two dimensional hilts.

But I think it is decent for a first model, especially when you look at some people’s first models. [/quote]To be honest, Krackkid’s “Two Sticks” looked horrible, yes it had smoothing used in it, but that was it.
And Krackkid has modelled for some longer time then newcomers, give these guys a chance.
If you guys want more active modellers don’t go and hate them because they aren’t that advanced as some people here.
They would just leave and get a shitty opinion about the modelling section, which isn’t what we want (In my opinion).

Read full topic

item.title: My First Model Ever :D [not a recolor]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

its not bad for a first, but its not great for one either. if you really have to make the blade and handle one mesh, atleast round it off so its not so noticeable. why would anyone use that when it means theyd be holding a handle as sharp as a blade?

Read full topic
